meanings.definition: Nuclides: a distinct kind of atom or nucleus characterized by a specific number of protons and neutrons.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study various nuclides to understand their unique structures.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician analyzed the nuclides under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The nuclides at the party were all protons and neutrons, mingling and dancing.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nuclides, each atom is like a tiny universe with its own rules.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful models to explain the concept of nuclides to the students.

meanings.definition: Nuclides: the different forms of an element that have the same atomic number but different mass numbers.
meanings.sent1: Isotopes are examples of nuclides with similar atomic numbers but different mass numbers.
meanings.sent2: The scientist compared the nuclides of carbon to illustrate isotopes.
meanings.sent3: The nuclides in the periodic table had a mass number party, each trying to stand out.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nuclides, isotopes are like siblings with similar features but different weights.
meanings.sent5: The textbook had colorful diagrams to help students differentiate between various nuclides.
